intro: Phyteuma hemisphaericum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellow or orange throat. The plant has linear to lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period typically occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a vibrant touch to garden landscapes.
